column4: you realize the default sh changed to dash from bash in the latest ubuntu release?
no I didn't notice, because I don't use either.
but that's good, bash has poor ksh compatibility
didnt know zsh provided sh capability
which isn't to say that there aren't other good shells, but that's the one I like.
yes, it has compatibility modes for ksh, sh, cshell, even bash if you have scripts with bash nuttiness in them.
I think you type the fewest characters with zsh.  I haven't used dash much, though.  I assume it's the default because it's low overhead.
might be the dash from busybox, I'll have to check.
err, i mean faster for running scripts.  thats why i use dash instead of bash for sh, it cuts minutes off some long scripts
right, just startup time would be a lot quicker
openoffice 'configure' script runs over a minute faster in dash than bash  :)
